sections.content: Welcome to the fascinating world of simple machines! ðŸŒŸ These tools are all around us, helping make work easier every day. Let's discover how they work and where we use them.
sections.title: Welcome to Simple Machines!

sections.content: A simple machine is a tool that changes the direction or amount of force needed to move objects. They don't create energy but make tasks easier by increasing efficiency.
sections.title: What Are Simple Machines?

sections.content: There are six main types of simple machines: lever, pulley, wheel and axle, inclined plane, wedge, and screw. Each has a unique way of helping us do work.
sections.title: The Six Types of Simple Machines

sections.content: A lever is a rigid bar that pivots on a point called the fulcrum. By applying force at one end, it can move a load at the other. Examples include seesaws and crowbars.
sections.title: Lever

sections.content: A pulley is a wheel with a groove that guides a rope or cable. It helps lift heavy loads by changing the direction of the applied force. Examples are flagpoles and cranes.
sections.title: Pulley

sections.content: A wheel and axle consist of a wheel attached to a central rod. Turning the wheel reduces friction, making it easier to move objects. Examples include bicycles and doorknobs.
sections.title: Wheel and Axle

sections.content: An inclined plane is a slanted surface that allows objects to be moved with less force. Examples include ramps and slides.
sections.title: Inclined Plane

sections.content: A wedge is a triangular tool used to split or cut objects. Applying force to its wide end drives it into material. Examples include knives and axes.
sections.title: Wedge

sections.content: A screw is an inclined plane wrapped around a cylinder. Turning it converts rotational force into linear force. Examples include jar lids and corkscrews.
sections.title: Screw

sections.content: Simple machines like ramps, scissors, and doorknobs simplify daily tasks by reducing force. They are essential in many tools and devices.
sections.title: Applications in Everyday Life
